Hero.description: From emotional AI companions to disaster prediction systems, we build technology that saves lives. Real impact, not just vanity metrics.
Hero.socialProof: Trusted by founders building the future

Features.description: We don't just write code. We solve meaningful problems with technology that actually works.

f1.title: Human-First Engineering
f1.desc: Great systems start with empathy. We design for humans first, ensuring technology serves people, not just algorithms.

f2.title: Zero-Waste Development
f2.desc: No bloated features. No technical debt. We build lean, powerful systems that solve actual problems.

f3.title: Collective Intelligence
f3.desc: Our distributed team operates as a single unit, combining diverse perspectives to create solutions no individual could imagine.

f4.title: Battle-Tested Systems
f4.desc: We build software as if lives depend on it. Because sometimes, they do. Robust, reliable, and ready for anything.

f5.title: Rapid Iteration
f5.desc: See progress in days, not months. We ship fast, gather feedback, and iterate until it's exceptional.

f6.title: Long-Term Partnership
f6.desc: Launch is just the beginning. We measure what matters and continuously enhance your solution.

Projects.description: Technology that changes lives, not just chases metrics.

rafiqi.title: Rafiqi
rafiqi.story: Mental health support that feels genuinely human. We built an AI companion that understands context, reads emotional nuance, and adapts to individual healing journeys. Support that is available whenever it is needed most.

repai.title: repAI
repai.story: What if recycling could pay your bills? RepAI transforms environmental responsibility into personal profit with real-time pricing, collector connections, and instant cashback rewards.

orbit.title: Orbit
orbit.story: Space made accessible. An interactive 3D solar system tracking Near-Earth Objects in real-time. We turn complex astronomical data into engaging education.

naveris.title: NAVERIS
naveris.story: Seconds matter when disaster strikes. Our AI predicts natural disasters with 91% tornado accuracy. This gives communities precious time to prepare and save lives.

HowItWorks.description: From the first conversation to launch, here is how we turn your vision into reality.

s1.title: Discovery
s1.desc: We don't just ask what you want, we uncover what you actually need. Deep conversations reveal the real challenge hiding behind the obvious one.

s2.title: Design
s2.desc: Every feature exists for a reason. We design systems that solve real problems with intentional choices and user-centered thinking.

s3.title: Build
s3.desc: We build like your users' lives depend on it. Every interaction is crafted, every edge case considered, and every detail refined until it is both functional and meaningful.

s4.title: Launch & Grow
s4.desc: Launch is just the beginning. We measure what matters, iterate based on real usage, and continuously enhance until your solution transforms lives.

t0.text: Judging the GDG Cairo hackathon, Masons stood out not just for their tech but for their incredible team energy. Top 7 well deserved!
t0.by: Mohamed, Senior Android Developer @ Yassir & GDG Hackthon Judge

t1.text: As a hackathon judge, I rarely see teams with such genuine passion. Masons creates an environment where creativity thrives.
t1.by: Mohamed, CTO @ Electro Pi & GDG Hackthon Judge

t2.text: Masons brought such positive energy to the hackathon. Their approach to problem-solving is both technical and deeply human.
t2.by: Qamar, Android Developer @ Yassir & GDG Hackthon Judge

t3.text: The collaborative spirit at Masons is unmatched. we felt like part of the family from day one.

t4.text: Judging their NASA project, I was impressed by their technical skills but blown away by their team dynamics. Special culture.
t4.by: Ayman, CTO @ North West Africa Nokia

t5.text: Masons creates an environment where learning never stops. The growth mindset here is absolutely contagious.

t6.text: At Masons, we focus on building a culture of trust, curiosity, and continuous improvement. Every milestone is a reflection of the team's dedication and shared vision.

t7.text: Seif showed excellent technical depth and leadership at DEPI. He leads by example and understands how to move teams with clarity and focus.
t7.by: Sayed Safwet, Senior Full Stack Engineer @ _VOIS & Mentor @ DEPI

FAQ.description: Everything you need to know before we start building together.

q1.question: How do you typically work with clients?
q1.answer: We start with a discovery conversation to understand your goals, then propose a collaborative approach. We believe in transparent communication, regular check-ins, and building solutions together rather than in isolation.

q2.question: What's your typical project timeline?
q2.answer: Most projects range from 6-16 weeks depending on scope. We work in focused sprints so you see progress quickly and can provide feedback along the way.

q3.question: Do you work with early-stage startups?
q3.answer: Absolutely. We love working with founders solving real problems. We can help validate ideas, build MVPs, and scale when you're ready to grow.

q4.question: What makes Masons different?
q4.answer: We are problem solvers, not just developers. From emotional AI to disaster prediction, we build technology that matters.

CTA.description: Whether you have a clear vision or just a burning problem that needs solving, let's talk. No pitch decks required. Just real conversations about real solutions.
CTA.trustNote: Typically respond within 24 hours. No spam, no pushy sales.

Footer.tagline: We build technology that changes lives and drives real impact.
Footer.newsletterDesc: Get occasional updates on our projects and insights.

About.heroIntro: Masons started in a coffee shop at 2AM. Three teenage devs sat huddled over half-dead laptops, half-full cups of bitter Turkish coffee, and fully charged dreams.
About.heroStory1: Back then, they were barely 16. Still figuring out what a for loop was, still learning to walk in the dev world without tripping over syntax errors. They had an idea: an app that could actually help people. So they mapped it out, picked a stack they barely knew, and dove in headfirst. For three months, they learned, built, dreamed. Everything felt like it was lining up.
About.heroStory2: Then one random day, just opening the Play Store to update Clash of Clans like any other normal teenager... bam. There it was. The exact same app. Built by someone else. Shipped. Polished. Everywhere. And it was good. Like, damn, hats-off kind of good. It crushed in Egypt. That sting? Yeah, it hurt. But respect where it's due. They got beat fair and square.
About.heroStory3: After that, life kicked in. One dev dipped. School got hectic. The dream went into deep freeze for a while. Third secondary, finals, the chaos of teenhood. Masons went quiet.
About.heroStory4: But legends don't stay dormant forever.
About.heroStory5: They graduated highschool. Life shifted. Seif crossed paths with two powerhouses: Ahmed Khalid, better known as Z3ln, and Sherif Lotfy, aka Sizif. Meanwhile, Abdelaziz met Omar Waleed in a different corner of the college cosmos. And just like that, the universe tossed a new challenge their way: NASA Space Apps Cairo 2023. That was the spark.
About.heroStory6: Seif called in the cavalry: his cousin Omar Ellaban. The puzzle pieces locked in. Six minds, six stories, one wild idea. For the first time, the Mighty Founding Six stood assembled.
About.heroStory7: When Rafiqi came into view, something shifted. The mission got real. They searched, reached out, brought new people into the fold. Each one brought a different background, a new way of thinking, skills the OGs didn't have. And that's what made the team powerful as hell. Not clones, but a crew of misfits with heart, grit, and range. Every one of them unique as hell.
About.heroStory8: From there, it was never about the hype. Not about slapping "AI-powered" on a landing page just to raise eyebrows. They weren't here for billion-dollar nothings.
About.heroStory9: They were here to build real stuff that mattered. Sometimes that meant AI that actually understood the context of a conversation, not just spit out buzzwords. Other times it was about infrastructure that didn't fall apart when 50,000 users showed up at once. Always, always, it was about putting people before ego.
About.heroStory10: This wasn't just a startup. This was Masons.
About.ctaDescription: Whether you need help bringing an idea to life, or want to join a team that gives a damn ‚Äî we'd love to talk. No pitch decks needed. Just real conversations about real problems worth solving.

seif.name: Seif Zakaria
seif.description: Just a guy who loves shipping apps that actually works. Deep in code, big on clarity, always chasing better systems.
seif.focus: Pretending it's simple until it actually is

omarWaleed.description: Teaches machines empathy. Writes algorithms that actually understand context.
